Get AmeriFlux site general info

Source: R/amf_site_info.R
amf_site_info.Rd

This function obtains the latest AmeriFlux site list and sites' general info through the AmeriFlux web service.

amf_site_info(contact_info = FALSE)

Arguments

contact_info

include contact info (TRUE / FALSE)

Value

A data frame containing the following columns. See AmeriFlux BADM standard https://ameriflux.lbl.gov/data/badm/ for detailed explanation.

  • SITE_ID - Six character site identifier (CC-Sss)

  • SITE_NAME - Site name (free text)

  • URL_AMERIFLUX - Site web site URL, maintained by AmeriFlux (URL)

  • TOWER_BEGAN - The starting year of flux measurement (YYYY)

  • TOWER_END - The ending year of flux measurement (YYYY), NA if still active or unspecified

  • IGBP - Vegetation type based on the IGBP definition (free text)

  • GRP_LOCATION.LOCATION_LAT - Latitude of the site (decimal deg ref WGS84)

  • GRP_LOCATION.LOCATION_LONG - Longitude of the site (decimal deg ref WGS84)

  • GRP_LOCATION.LOCATION_ELEV - Elevation of the site above sea level (m)

  • GRP_CLIM_AVG.MAT - Long-term mean annual average air temperature (degree C)

  • GRP_CLIM_AVG.MAP - Long-term mean annual average precipitation (mm)

  • GRP_CLIM_AVG.CLIMATE_KOEPPEN - Koppen climate classification (free text)

  • DATA_START - The starting year with published AmeriFlux data (YYYY)

  • DATA_END - The ending year with published AmeriFlux data (YYYY)

  • TEAM_MEMBER_PI1 - Site principal investigator #1 name (First/Given Last/Family)

  • TEAM_MEMBER_PI1_EMAIL - Site principal investigator #1 email (free text)

  • TEAM_MEMBER_PI2 - Site principal investigator #2 name (First/Given Last/Family)

  • TEAM_MEMBER_PI2_EMAIL - Site principal investigator #2 email (free text)

  • TEAM_MEMBER_PI3 - Site principal investigator #3 name (First/Given Last/Family)

  • TEAM_MEMBER_PI3_EMAIL - Site principal investigator #3 email (free text)

Details

This combines the information of various other functions.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
# obtain the basic general info for all sites
site <- amf_site_info()
}
